body:
This sounds like you're exceptionally close to having this solved. To be sure, check that the following are done:

  1. Make sure you're including the user name and password when accessing the location.

Goes like this:

net use Q: \\Server\files < password > /User:<username>

Or the following if you want to use Jenkins' variables:

net use Q: \\Server\files < password > /User:%USERNAME%

Replace < password > with your actual password.

  1. Finally, make sure that the Jenkins user has write access to the SharePoint document library. There are groups within the SharePoint system that will indicate what kind of permissions the user will have. You'll may need rights yourself to even see these lists. Just make sure those are lined up.
title: Jenkins Publishing to SharePoint
